reviewText:
Hey, everyone!
I`m not a native speaker, so sorry for bad english.

Briefly:

To skip the level, you have to click the button on the left corner many times.
If you are looking for the game graphics, action and simplicity, then don`t buy, because this game
is definitely not for you. Here it`s necessary to think. And you have to think a lot. The game is really very,very difficult.

Pros:
Extremely hard puzzle set;
puzzles of varying difficulty;
long gameplay

Cons:
graphics – for mobile phones;
you can't kill anyone.

Conclusion.
If you love chess, math, logic, like to think – this game for ya.
If not, then better don't buy it, because you may end up on the first puzzle.


Fully:

The plot.
Proceed directly to the game.
Some kinds of puzzles I can`t pass in principle.
The entering puzzle which solves 1 out of 10 as stated by developer. I don`t know for sure (will see on
the achievements stats), but I spent about 15 minutes for solving it and 10 of them I tried to understanddependence of the color changes when clicks on this or other square. By the way, my wife couldn’t solve
it)))

Generally, I've seen about 15 kinds of puzzles. Puzzles description I will give below.

Puzzles (sorted by my preference):
-Chess puzzle. Various tasks with chess pieces. Solved 5 pieces. How much whole is unknown.
. Difficulty - impossible.
-Honeycombs and Balls and (in the achievement is Hex and Infection). Two different puzzles, but the
mechanics are similar. Difficulty – average.
-Battleship, battleship and Minesweeper (two different puzzles). It is necessary to place the ships on thebattlefield. Difficulty - high.
- Chinese checkers. You need to remove all the checkers from the Board. Difficulty - average.
- Ordinary checkers. Usually you need to change the white/black checkers for a limited number of
moves. Difficulty - high.
- Coins. I've seen two types of puzzles. Pick up the last coin and flip all the coins. Difficulty - high.
- Billiards. Need to drive the ball in the right pocket.
- Puzzles with pictures (similar to first). Everyone besides the first I skipped. Difficulty - impossible!
- 15 puzzle. Difficulty - high.
- The game is similar to 15 puzzle. Mechanics like 15 puzzle. Difficulty – high
- The Rubik's cube. Difficulty - impossible. Could not solve any one, all skipped.
- Packer (judging by the name this is what you need) something like Tetris. Need to pack all of the
shapes in the playing field. Difficulty - impossible!
- Domino. You need to correctly place the dominoes on the playing field. Difficulty - impossible!. All skipped.

I've seen not all the puzzles if to believe to the list of achievements.

reviewText: The instructions aren't very clear on some puzzles. For example, the one about dice says to click on an adjecent die to move" in that direction. However
date: the puzzle fails to even tell you what the objectinve of the puzzle is. I spent ten minutes randomly clicking on dice until I passed (somehow). On two-player boards
recommended: the AI plays ridiculously well (and you always play first)
hoursPlayed: so you spend the entire board playing defensively against a tough opponent.\n\nOverall
voteText: the game isn't fun."

reviewText: 'Mind Games' is a collection of several brain teasers. You will recognize some of them, while others may be new to you. Look at the screenshots to get an idea of the kind of problems you will be solving. I think most of them are fun, but some are just frustrating. Yeah, I'm looking at you, swap the bishops".\n\nYes
date: I clicked the button to recommend this game
recommended: but just barely. 'Mind Games' has a lot of problems. To be blunt
hoursPlayed: for the most part it comes across as pretty amateurish:\n\n- There is no in-game menu whatsoever. No basic options e.g. for graphics and sound
voteText: but also no menu that shows your progress or that allows you to go back to previous puzzles you may want to replay because you liked them. You have three buttons in-game: one to exit mind games
helpfulPercent: one to show the instructions for the current level on the screen and one to reset the current level. There is also no hint system or another way to progress in 'Mind Games' when you're stuck at one particular level. Well
votesHelpful: because there is an achievement for skipping a level I went looking for the way to do that. Turns out the 'hint' you see in the second screenshot on this product page
votesTotal: i.e. "You can skip the level by pressing left-top reset button 100 times" is no joke. Not very user-friendly
votesFunny: is it?\n\n- The whole audio track is just copied from the game 'The 7th Guest' (also available on Steam). I can't help but wonder if this is even legal
commentsCount: but that's not up to me to look into. But more to the point
column16: 'The 7th Guest' was set in a haunted mansion so the creepy sounds
column17: the ominous music and the maniacal laughter fit that atmosphere. But in 'Mind Games'
column18: where you're just solving brain teasers
column19: it feels completely out of place.\n\n- The instructions you get for each brain teaser are written in very bad English. Sometimes this causes you to have no clue at all what you're supposed to do and you'll need to figure it out by trial and error
column20: or by looking up the solution on the net
column22: of course. 'Mind games' adresses the player as 'my friend'
column23: just like in those terrible e-mails you get when buying something from the countries er... 'on the eastern side of the planet' (Russia
column26: ...). They don't understand the western side of the globe thinks it's weird to call any and all strangers "my friend".\n\n- Some of the Steam Achievements are bugged. E.g. there are some achievements that require you to complete 40
column28: but the counters for those 3 achievements is stuck at 6 for me and
column30: for a number of other players
column31: too. According to the same forum
column32: other achievements used to be bugged but were fixed
column33: so maybe the current bugged achievements will get fixed in the near future
column34: as well.\n\nSo there you have it. If you like challenging brain teasers and find 'Mind Games' on sale
column35: you have little to lose by buying it. But 'Mind Games' really needs some more work to stop it from sticking out like a sore thumb in the huge selection of puzzle games Steam has to offer. Most notably it needs original and better suited music and sound effects
column36: an in-game menu with at least some basic options and a native English speaker to rewrite the instructions which are hard to understand as they are right now."

reviewText:
Before I give my review I'd like to say I got this game for free from a giveaway so as to whether this game is worth the price (which I feel it is) I can't give a good answer but it's cheap enough that I think it's worth getting.

Now as to if the game is good or not depends entirely on the person, it's a challenging puzzle game that makes you think about your next three moves in advance and can be difficult to progress without learning the patterns. It's fun and intersting and at this point in time the developers are really active with the game and fixing any issues that pop up, which does happen sometimes. This is a very enjoyable game which, depending on how good you are at puzzles, may cause the game to last for a very long time for you (with some of the puzzles seeming to be very complex to figure out).

Now for the negatives:
- Some of the puzzles seem extremely similar to each other and once you figure out how to solve the puzzle it becomes very simple to do so. So, if two puzzles have the same solution despite it being two seperate puzzles it feels like you're only solving one.
- The puzzles in the game aren't all exactly original so it's possible you may have already seen one or more of these puzzles before, personally I've seen a few puzzles I already knew how to solve due to having done them years before.
- While this game is advertised as extremely hard brain twisting puzzles" some of them are so simple a child could do it. This is not an exaggeration
date: my last point about having played some of these puzzles years ago is a perfect example. I can easily remember solving some of these puzzles as a child and not having any real challenges doing so.\n- Currently (March 7
recommended:
2016) while the game does say it has Steam trading cards it actually does not have any. EDIT: Cards have been added.
- This game has a very small repetitive sound file with little to no background noise.

All that being said if you are a fan of puzzle games these  puzzles may not be as hard as described but they are challenging as well as fun and this game is certainly enjoyable for what it is."
voteText: true

reviewText: The difficulty level is artificially increased. The best exemple to describe this is like Take the Tic-Tact-Toe game
date: write some code that make the AI invincible an then present the game as challenging". Unfortunately Mind Games starts from a very good and simple ideea but fails to deliver something that is both fun and difficult at the same time. The main complaints are:\n- For quite a few puzzles the objective is not clearly stated (ex. for Nim levels
recommended:
it doesn't say what are the conditions for winning - I had to google Nim in order to figure it out)
- The AI is ridiculously difficult for the firts levels
- The "Skip" button is a joke (really?!!!)
- It was that hard to provide a way to revisit previous levels? Or it was intentionaly ?

Sorry for bad gramma etc

The conclusion: the game should have been polished a litlle bit before release and the description is misleading"

reviewText: The puzzles are challenging, well made, fun.  The downside here is that you have to solve them in order, one at a time.  You can skip one if you're having difficulty or just don't happen to like it, but you have to click a certain spot 100 times.  There is no way of returning to a previously solved puzzle.  It would be so much more fun if you could just pick any  puzzle you feel like doing.  Nevertheless, I recommend Mind Games for the puzzles and the good price.

reviewText:
This game is essentially a randomized puzzle game with various mechanics you have to learn to solve the puzzle... I'm 10 in and I've gotten

1) 15 Square
2) Ataxx
3) Jigsaw puzzles
4) Lights out or Lights tinted (think RGB into creating an image of the same color)
5) Magic Squares (all Horizontals/Verticals/Diagonals are a # using various things like dice, dominoes, or cards)
6) Flip the bishops without having a bishop kill a bishop of another color
7) Lots of Chinese Checker type puzzles


They are pretty much random... some are simple, some complicated, some are WTF am I doing and why would you play this? Because your a puzzle master... or claim to be one on TV... I love it because you think... you swear at it, then you solve it and go Was that a eureka? or a GLAD THAT $#!T IS OVER NEXT!!!!"

Graphics are meh
date: gameplay may last awhile if you dont' cheat... and its cheap... Only buy if you ARE a puzzle master
recommended: skip if your a puzzle scrubber."

reviewText:
https://youtu.be/F45nsSJHrG8

The is no doubt that these puzzles offer a lot of challenge to players, however challenge alone is not enough to provide enjoyment.  Without a narrative these puzzles are presented in a dry uninteresting slog.

Many of these puzzles are presented without proper instructions on what the goal is or how to move the pieces.  Additionally many puzzle designs used are created to put the first player at a disadvantage and rely on luck of the AI making a mistake in order to win.
